Word.Name: นั่ง
Word.EngDesc: The a (ั) is pronounced like in bar, car or cut

Word.Name: แขน
Word.EngDesc: The æ (แ) is pronounced like (british) bag, care or Rabbit

Word.Name: หัวใจ
Word.EngDesc: The ai (ใ) is pronounced like in die, eye or Thai

Word.Name: สีดำ
Word.EngDesc: The am (ำ) is pronounced like in (british) rum

Word.Name: เป็ด
Word.EngDesc: The e is (เ) pronounced like in get, jet, let

Word.Name: เบียร์
Word.EngDesc: The ea (เีย) is pronounced like in beer, dear, gear.ร์ is not pronounced following the rules to closing sounds

Word.Name: ตี
Word.EngDesc: The ee ี is pronounced like in bee, sea

Word.Name: เพลง
Word.EngDesc: The ee (เ) is pronounced like in bread, dead

Word.Name: กา
Word.EngDesc: The g (ก) is pronounced like in get, go, grand

Word.Name: หงส์
Word.EngDesc: The h (ห) is pronounced like in hand, hard

Word.Name: ลิ้น
Word.EngDesc: the i (ิ) is pronounced like in bit, Italy, sit

Word.Name: โต๊ะ
Word.EngDesc: The o (โ) is pronounced like in hope, toe, tone

Word.Name: เดิน
Word.EngDesc: The eer (เิ) is pronounced like in Bird, Burn, term, girl

Word.Name: จอ
Word.EngDesc: The aaw (อ) is pronounced like in aunt, ball, dog

Word.Name: คุก
Word.EngDesc: The oo (ุ) is pronounced like in butcher, put

Word.Name: โยน
Word.EngDesc: The y is pronounced like in year, yes

Word.Name: ตั๋ว
Word.EngDesc: The uaa (ัว) is pronounced like in tour, poor

Word.Name: มือ
Word.EngDesc: Simply has to be practiced with sound

Word.Name: เมือง
Word.EngDesc: Simply has to be practised with sound

Word.Name: ก
Word.EngDesc: These are the consonants with the normal tone class

Word.Name: ก
Word.EngDesc: There are 3 closing sounds called stop sounds

Word.Name: ทาน
Word.EngDesc: This า is pronounced as a long A.

Word.Name: ท่าน
Word.EngDesc: This า is pronounced short, notice how similar it is to ทาน

Word.Name: เกิน
Word.EngDesc: In most cases the long vowel เออ changes to เิ when followed by another consonant. Therfor yuo should not write it as เกอน.

Word.Name: เสียงสามัญ

ThaiScript.string: เสียงสามัญ

Word.EngDesc: The normal tone.

Word.Name: เสียงเอก
Word.EngDesc: The low tone. also know as the second tone.

Word.Name: ทรง
Word.EngDesc: The letter combination ทร is usually pronounced as S

Word.Name: เด็ก
Word.EngDesc: This is how you say a child.

Word.Name: เด็กเด็ก
Word.EngDesc: Thai nouns don't have a grametical gender, no articles and no plural forms. but there is a classifier system for the correct use of nouns

Word.Name: ฉัน
Word.EngDesc: In Thai the gender of the speaking person is important. chan is used by women.

Word.Name: ครับ
Word.EngDesc: In Thai particles are used to show emotion and politness to the one you are speaking too.

Word.Name: ค่ะ
Word.EngDesc: In Thai particles are used to show emotion and politness to the one you are speaking too. Ka is used by women.

Word.Name: ตี
Word.EngDesc: Morning hours between 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.

Word.Name: ข
Word.EngDesc: These are the consonants with the High tone class

Word.Name: ค
Word.EngDesc: These are the consonants with the Low tone class

Word.Name: ง
Word.EngDesc: There are 3 closing sounds called stop sounds called Nasal sounds

Word.Name: ย
Word.EngDesc: These 3 letters are usually part of a Vowel

Word.Name: ฉ

ThaiScript.string: ฌ ผ ฝ ฟ ห ฮ

EngWords.string: Words never stop with any of these.

Word.EngDesc: These 8 letters never occure at the end of a word.

Word.Name: ญ
Word.EngDesc: These 4 letters changes the sound น (no) if at the end of a word.

Word.Name: ข
Word.EngDesc: The three kho sounds changes into a K (The consonant ก changes sound from g to k at the end of a word).

Word.Name: ผ
Word.EngDesc: The three sounds for ph- turns into pho or bo

Word.Name: ฎ
Word.EngDesc: The four d sounds mostly keep their sound or turn into dt-

Word.Name: จ
Word.EngDesc: The letters with the sounds j, t, s, and ch turn into dt.

Word.Name: เดิน
Word.EngDesc: In most cases the long vowel เออ changes to เิ when followed by another consonant. Therfor yuo should not write it as เดอน.

Word.Name: เค็ด
Word.EngDesc: This word has the symbol ็ above the consonant, and indicates that the vowel is short.

Word.Name: ถนน
Word.EngDesc: This word is hard to read for a foreigner as it only contains consonants, but in Thai ther are often a unwritten vowel with either the sound a or o.

Word.Name: กบ
Word.EngDesc: To say this word (and many other words) you say an o between the consonants.

Word.Name: คน
Word.EngDesc: To say this word (and many other words) you say an o between the consonants.

Word.Name: ตลาด
Word.EngDesc: Sometimes you have to add an additional a between consonants.

Word.Name: สมอง
Word.EngDesc: Sometimes you have to add an additional a between consonants.

Word.Name: ตะบอง
Word.EngDesc: There are many words where the a is written.

Word.Name: สะอาด
Word.EngDesc: There are many words where thhe a is written.

Word.Name: จระเข้
Word.EngDesc: There are a few words with an additional aaw.

Word.Name: บริษัท
Word.EngDesc: There are a few words with an additional aaw

Word.Name: เสียงโท
Word.EngDesc: The Falling tone. also know as the third tone.

Word.Name: เสียงตรี
Word.EngDesc: The high tone. also know as the Fourth tone.

Word.Name: เสียงจัตวา

ThaiScript.string: เสียงจัตวา

Word.EngDesc: The Rising tone. also know as the fifth tone.

Word.Name: กะ
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a short vowel, making the word pronounced with a low tone.

Word.Name: กบ
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a stop sound, making the word pronounced with a low tone.
This is the thai name of this symbol. It is placed above the consonant and indicates that the vowel has to be pronounced short.

Word.Name: นก
Word.EngDesc: To pronounce this word you need to add an additional o between ม and ก.

Word.Name: กา
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a long vowel sound, making the word pronounced with a normal tone.

Word.Name: กัน
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a nasal sound, making the word pronounced with a normal tone.

Word.Name: คะ
Word.EngDesc: [word added by a female speaker to the end of every question to convey politeness] Consonant is of the low tone class and has a short vowel, making the word pronounced with a high tone.

Word.Name: สูท
Word.EngDesc: Thai transcription of the foreign loanword. Consonant is of the high tone class and has a stop sound, making the word pronounced with a low tone.

Word.Name: สี
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the high tone class and has a long vowel, making the word pronounced with a rising tone.

Word.Name: สัน

EngWords.string: the long line of the back

Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the high tone class and has a nasal sound, making the word pronounced with a rising tone.

Word.Name: คิด
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the low tone class and has a short vowel and a stop sound, making the word pronounced with a high tone.

Word.Name: คีบ

EngWords.string: to take up by means of forceps

Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the low tone class and has a long vowel and a stop sound, making the word pronounced with a falling tone.

Word.Name: คือ
Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the low tone class and has a long vowel, making the word pronounced with the normal tone.

Word.Name: คัน

EngWords.string: or feel a need to scratch or sneeze

Word.EngDesc: Consonant is of the low tone class and has a nasal sound, making the word pronounced with the normal tone.
Name of the symbol for the low tone
Name of the symbol for the falling tone
Name of the symbol for the Hightone
Name of the symbol for the rising tone
When the initial consonant is a low tone, the tone mark indicates this tone for the word.
This tone mark changes to the high tone instead of the falling tone when the consonant is a low tone.
This mark has two names and it indicates that the consonant is silent and not pronounced.

Word.Name: ๆ
Word.EngDesc: This mark indicates repetition. The word is said twice which is important for the plkural or emphasize of things.

Word.Name: ฯ
Word.EngDesc: This mark indicates what should follow is understod. E.g. Bangkok, the 'City of Angels'.

Word.Name: ฯลฯ
Word.EngDesc: This mark has the same meaning as so on or et cetera.

Word.Name: หญ้า
Word.EngDesc: The initial consonant is silent and only affect the tone. This word gets a falling tone.

Word.Name: หนู
Word.EngDesc: The initial consonant is silent and only affect the tone. This word get a rising tone.

Word.Name: อย่า
Word.EngDesc: The initial consonant is silent and only affect the tone. This word get a low tone.

Word.Name: อยาก
Word.EngDesc: The initial consonant is silent and only affect the tone. This word get a low tone.

Word.Name: อย่าง
Word.EngDesc: The initial consonant is silent and only affect the tone. This word get a low tone.

Word.Name: อยู่
Word.EngDesc: The initial consonant is silent and only affect the tone. This word get a low tone.

Word.Name: ทราย
Word.EngDesc: The letter combination ทร is usually pronounced as S

Word.Name: กรรไกร
Word.EngDesc: The letter combination รร can be pronounced as "an" or "a".

Word.Name: ธรรมดา
Word.EngDesc: The letter combination รร can be pronounced as "an" or "a".

Word.Name: พร
Word.EngDesc: When ร is the closing sound it changes the vowel before it from an o (โอ) to an aaw (อ).

Word.Name: ศร
Word.EngDesc: When ร is the closing sound it changes the vowel before it from an o (โอ) to an aaw (อ).

Word.Name: ตรง
Word.EngDesc: when the letters ร, ล or ว is the second consonant in a word it can either be pronounced together with the first consonant or with an additional a.

Word.Name: นรก
Word.EngDesc: when the letters ร, ล or ว is the second consonant in a word it can either be pronounced together with the first consonant or with an additional a.

Word.Name: ปลอม
Word.EngDesc: when the letters ร, ล or ว is the second consonant in a word it can either be pronounced together with the first consonant or with an additional a.

Word.Name: ตลาด
Word.EngDesc: when the letters ร, ล or ว is the second consonant in a word it can either be pronounced together with the first consonant or with an additional a.

Word.Name: ควาย
Word.EngDesc: when the letters ร, ล or ว is the second consonant in a word it can either be pronounced together with the first consonant or with an additional a.

Word.Name: สว่าง
Word.EngDesc: when the letters ร, ล or ว is the second consonant in a word it can either be pronounced together with the first consonant or with an additional a.

Word.Name: คน
Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for persons/occupations]

Word.Name: คัน

EngWords.string: or feel a need to scratch or sneeze

Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for vehicles; cars; umbrellas; etc.]

Word.Name: ตัว
Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for digits; number; bodies; shirts; pants; suits; animals; fish; germs; chairs; tables; desks; software title]

Word.Name: ใบ
Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for bottles; drinking glasses; backpacks; money; leaves; sheets; hats; cards and other flat objects; eggs]; [colloquial classifier for eggs]

Word.Name: ลำ
Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for long curved objects such as ships, airplanes, bamboo, etc.]

Word.Name: สาย
Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for roads, strings, wires, rivers, and other stringy things]; method; route; way; [of air] gust; [of rain] falling streaks; [of lightning] bolts; [of water in a stream] current.

Word.Name: อัน
Word.EngDesc: [numerical classifier for small things]

Word.Name: การ
Word.EngDesc: [placed before a verb or noun to create a noun which indicates a general activity, process, or state] the process of..., the activity of..., an enactment of..., the state of...

Word.Name: ความ

EngWords.string: the topic or essential matter of

Word.EngDesc: [a prefix which converts an adjective or verb into a noun]

Word.Name: การเริ่ม
Word.EngDesc: [placed before a verb or noun to create a noun which indicates a general activity, process, or state] the process of..., the activity of..., an enactment of..., the state of...

Word.Name: ความคิด
Word.EngDesc: [a prefix which converts an adjective or verb into a noun]

Word.Name: ผม
Word.EngDesc: [a prefix which conveys the gender of the speaker] Men says pom.

Word.Name: พี่
Word.EngDesc: [a polite pronoun for addressing an older sibling (including as oneself)] him; her; you; me

Word.Name: น้อง
Word.EngDesc: [noun of direct address to a younger person, e.g., a waitress] Miss. When unsure of the other persons age it is best to use (พี่) pee instead of (น้อง) naawng.

Word.Name: ชาย
Word.EngDesc: This is how you adress another man or male.

Word.Name: สาว
Word.EngDesc: This is how you adress another woman or female.

Word.Name: ปู่
Word.EngDesc: Grandfather of the fathers side.

Word.Name: ย่า

Word.Name: ยาย
Word.EngDesc: Grandmother of the mothers side.

Word.Name: ป้า

Word.Name: อา

Word.Name: น้า
Word.EngDesc: younger sibling of mother.

Word.Name: คะ
Word.EngDesc: [word added by a female speaker to the end of every question to convey politeness]

Word.Name: ซิ
Word.EngDesc: [a particle which conveys urgency, adding an imperative quality] (this is the way it is or must be)

Word.Name: นะ
Word.EngDesc: [word added to the end of a sentence to soften it, make it polite, indicate pleading, disagreement, ordering, surprise or emphasis]

Word.Name: มั้ง
Word.EngDesc: [particle indicating perhaps; that could be; possibly that just mentioned see]

Word.Name: ละ
Word.EngDesc: [a particle used at the end of a statement or question to add an imperative quality]

Word.Name: ล่ะ

Word.EngDesc: [informal, spoken pronunciation of ละ a particle used at the end of a statement or question to add an imperative quality]

Word.Name: หรอก
Word.EngDesc: [word often used with statements of contradiction or negation]

Word.Name: วัน

Word.Name: คืน
Word.EngDesc: This is how you say night. Can also be used as a verb to say give back (to); to return (to)

Word.Name: กลาง
Word.EngDesc: กลาง means during or in the middle of.

Word.Name: กลางคืน

Word.Name: ตอน

Word.Name: ช่วง

Word.Name: ตอนเช้า
Word.EngDesc: Most often refers to the morning.

Word.Name: ช่วงเช้า

Word.Name: เมื่อกี้

ThaiScript.string: หกโมงสิบห้านาที

ThaiFonet.string: hohk mohng sip haa naa tee

Word.EngDesc: To say this you must think of it as 6 o'clock, 5 minutes. the format therfor is number, word for hour, number, word ofr minut.

Word.Name: หกโมงยี่สิบนาที

ThaiScript.string: หกโมงยี่สิบนาที

ThaiFonet.string: hohk mohng yee sip naa tee

Word.EngDesc: To say this you must think of it as 6 o'clock, 5 minutes. the format therfor is number, word for hour, number, word of minut.

Word.Name: หกโมงยี่สิบห้านาที

ThaiFonet.string: hohk mohng yee sip haa naa tee

Word.EngDesc: To say this you must think of it as 6 o'clock, 5 minutes. the format therfor is number, word for hour, number, word of minut.

Word.Name: หกโมงสามสิบนาที

ThaiScript.string: หกโมงสามสิบนาที

ThaiFonet.string: hohk mohng saam sip naa tee

Word.EngDesc: To say this you must think of it as 6 o'clock, 30 minutes. the format therfor is number, word for hour, number, word of minut.

Word.Name: หกโมงครึ่ง

ThaiScript.string: หกโมงครึ่ง

Word.EngDesc: To say this you must think of it as 6 o'clock and half. The format therfor is number, word for hour and the word for half.

Word.Name: หกโมงสามสิบห้านาที

Word.Name: วันจันทร์
Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, monday is named after the moon. Simply translated monday in thai is day of the moon.

Word.Name: วันอังคาร
Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, tuesday is named after mars. Simply translated tuesday in thai is day of mars.

Word.Name: วันพุธ
Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, tuesday is named after Mercury . Simply translated wednesday in thai is day of Mercury .

Word.Name: วันพฤหัสบดี

ThaiScript.string: วันพฤหัสบดี

ThaiFonet.string: wan phreu hat sa baaw dee

Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, thursday is named after Jupiter . Simply translated thursday in thai is day of Jupiter.

Word.Name: วันศุกร์
Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, friday is named after venus. Simply translated friday in thai is day of Venus.

Word.Name: วันเสาร์
Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, saturday is named after Saturn. Simply translated saturday in thai is day of Saturn.

Word.Name: วันอาทิตย์

ThaiScript.string: วันอาทิตย์

Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, Sunday is named after the sun. simply translated sunday in thai is day of the sun.

Word.Name: วันที่
Word.EngDesc: The word for a date on a calendar.

Word.Name: วันนี้
Word.EngDesc: Simple translation means "day this".

Word.Name: วันทำงาน
Word.EngDesc: Simplye translated into day to to work.

Word.Name: วันหยุด
Word.EngDesc: Simplye translated into day to to stop.

Word.Name: วันพระ
Word.EngDesc: The Buddhist Sabbath generally occurs once a week in accordance with the phases of the moon in the lunar calendar.

Word.Name: มกราคม
Word.EngDesc: The pronunciation of this word illustrates reduplication, where a single written consonant serves as the final consonant of a syllable and is then pronounced again as the initial consonant of the following syllable.

Word.EngDesc: Held on the full moon of the third lunar month to commemorate the preaching of the Buddha to 1250 enlightened monks who came to hear him without prior summons

Word.EngDesc: Songkran has become a significant annual celebration in Thailand—around the country there are parades and people throw buckets of water on passers-by.

Word.Name: สีแดง
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in red on Sundays.

Word.Name: สีเหลือง
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in yellow on mondays.

Word.Name: สีชมพู
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in pink on Tuesday.

Word.Name: สีเขียว
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in green on wednesdays.

Word.Name: สีส้ม
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in orange on thursday.

Word.Name: สีฟ้า
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in light blue on fridays.

Word.Name: สีม่วง
Word.EngDesc: สี (see) is the word for color. Traditionally women used to dress in purple on saturday.
